thread.title: Detroiters celebrate Shake Shack's downtown opening
thread.title_full: Detroiters celebrate Shake Shack's downtown opening

author: Detroit Free Press Food Writer
title: Detroiters celebrate Shake Shack's downtown opening
text:
Detroiters celebrate Shake Shack's downtown opening Hundreds of hungry burger fans lined-up outside awaiting the opening the first Michigan Shake Shack. Post to Facebook Detroiters celebrate Shake Shack's downtown opening Hundreds of hungry burger fans lined-up outside awaiting the opening the first Michigan Shake Shack.   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2lA8OgD   Join the Conversation   Detroiters celebrate Shake Shack's downtown opening Susan Selasky , Detroit Free Press Food Writer 2:08 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Buy Photo Shake Shack brings its first store to Michigan,located in the First National Building in downtown Detroit. Kathleen Galligan, Detroit Free Press Fullscreen Buy Photo Shake Shack's Motor City Mix--vanilla custard, peanut butter sauce, Bon Bon Bon dark chocolate with Rocky's honey roasted peanuts and chocolate toffee. Kathleen Galligan, Detroit Free Press Shake Shack brings its first store to Michigan. Kathleen Galligan, Detroit Free Press Shack brings its first store to Michigan. Kathleen Galligan, Detroit Free Press Shake Shack brings its first store to Michigan. Kathleen Galligan, Detroit Free Press Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Shake Shack opens in downtown Detroit, Thursday, Feb. 23, 2017. (Photo: Kathleen Galligan/Detroit Free Press) Buy Photo 47 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Hundreds of hungry burger fans lined-up today on a Detroit sidewalk on an unusually warm February day eager for the doors to open at the first Michigan Shake Shack. 
This New York-based burger chain is noted for their burgers and Concretes (high-speed spun custard with mix-ins) and located on Woodward on the ground floor of the First National Building in Detroit. 
Just steps from Campus Martius, customers were excited to see the burger chain open, clapping, cheering and giving high-fives to employees as they walked in. At one point the line stretched well around the corner of the building. 
Before the opening, the first 50 people in line received sunglasses, wrist bands and a Shake Shack T-shirt designed by John Varvatos, a Detroit native and menswear designer with a menswear store on Woodward. 
The first customers in line were four Grosse Pointe North students on mid-winter break.The four -- Maddie Macconnachie, Stephanie Roy, Adam Schade and Madison Delas -- all 17, said they’d been in line since 9 a.m. Buy Photo 
A huge lunch crowd gathers as Shake Shack celebrates its Grand Opening in downtown Detroit, Thursday, Feb. 23, 2017. (Photo: Kathleen Galligan/Detroit Free Press) 
Macconnachie had been to Shake Shack in New York City and had their burgers. A vegetarian, Macconachie’s planned on ordering the ‘Shroom burger, a crisp-fried Portobello mushrooms filled with melted muenster and cheddar cheeses, topped with lettuce, tomato and shack sauce. 
It’s the shack sauce that is Macconachie’s favorite. 
Matt Meyer, area director for the Midwest region, said today’s opening was “especially exciting being in the “D”. 
“It’s the energy and excitement of having us be a part of the rebirth here,” Meyer said. “We are fortunate and happy ... this never gets old,” Meyer said. 
Zach Koff, Shake Shack chief operating officer, echoed Meyer’s sentiment. “This building is an amazing building,” Koff said. “This area is where Detroit comes together. We are happy to be part of the resurgence. “ 47 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE
